answers.answer: The main ways to enter Romania are by obtaining temporary protection, with a short-stay right, or as an asylum seeker. You can also apply for asylum within Romania at a later point.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'My rights'.

answers.answer: One can seek asylum by entering Romania as an asylum seeker or by applying for asylum within Romania, either in writing or verbally. If you cannot present any documents upon entering Romania, you will need to apply for asylum at the border.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Applying for asylum'.

answers.answer: Your rights in Romania depend on your status. If you are a beneficiary of temporary protection, your permit is automatically valid until 03/04/2026. From the moment you ask for asylum, you are considered an asylum seeker and cannot be removed (deported) to your country of origin.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'My rights'.

answers.answer: Temporary protection is a special form of protection for people fleeing the war in Ukraine. If you are already a beneficiary of temporary protection, your permit is automatically valid until 03/04/2026.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Temporary protection'.

answers.answer: Support can be found in Poland, Moldova, Hungary, and The Slovak Republic. Each country provides hotlines and/or websites for further information.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'For support in other European countries'.
